topic.title: Device Overview

body.p: The DIGI-G5 represents Microsemi’s fifth generation of high-capacity, multi-rate and channelized single-chip OTN processors optimized for Transponders, Muxponders, Data Center Interconnect (DCI) platforms and Line Cards for Packet/OTN switching platforms (P-OTPs).

Built on the foundation of OTN Processing IP from Microsemi’s industry leading DIGI family, which is widely deployed in communications service provider and internet content service provider networks today, the DIGI-G5 is an ultra-high density and Ethernet/Packet optimized OTN processor. The DIGI-G5 has the feature integration, lowest power per port and scalability to enable mass deployment of 100G+ packet optical transport networks. The DIGI-G5 enables the network evolution to support flexible 100G+ Ethernet and packet services.

Leveraging multi-generations of field proven, carrier-grade Microsemi OTN Software API libraries, the DIGI-G5 can be leveraged across multiple line card designs, applications and equipment platforms to reduce OEM development costs while accelerating their time to market.
The DIGI-G5 expands the award winning DIGI family, adding key new features while maintaining critical capabilities such as:

ul.li: Highly channelized OTN architecture, supporting single-chip applications, up to 1.2T of device interface bandwidth.
50% less power per 100G port compared to the previous generation.
Standards compliant OTUCn support, enabling “Beyond 100G” OTN applications.
Full Flexible Ethernet (FlexE) support, including unaware, aware and terminated mapping modes.
Support for Flexible OTN (FlexO) inter-domain (IrDI) interfaces, enabling Nx100G OTN hand-offs.
Integrated high-speed 56Gb/s PAM-4 SERDES, enabling direct connectivity with next generation Coherent DSPs, Optical transceivers, Fabric Interface Chips (FICs), fabrics and backplanes.
Next-generation IEEE compliant Ethernet client support from 10GE to 400GE.
FIPS 197 certified AES-256 “CrypOTN” OTN payload encryption engine, enabling secure, protocol agnostic, low latency, wire-speed transport (PM6010 only).
Per port non-intrusive LLDP packet monitoring for Ethernet and FlexE clients, enabling WAN topology auto-discovery in DCI and SDN controlled applications.

Flexible Interlaken system interfaces, enabling up to 500G hybrid OTN and packet line/client card for centralized switching architectures or up to 3x200G distributed meshed OTN switching architectures.
Integrated GCC processor, reducing the need for auxiliary components and lowering the overall line card BOM cost.

Integrated high performance embedded ARM A9 1.2GHz CPU, allowing the device SDK to be offloaded from the host CPU – allowing the same software performance as DIGI-G4 without having to upgrade the external CPU architecture.

body.p: The device supports a wide number of client and line-side protocols and interfaces. The DIGI-G5 integrates high-speed SERDES for all rates, from 10Gb/s NRZ to 56Gb/s PAM-4. The device supports system resources using Interlaken for both ODUks and data packets, and can be connected to Ethernet switches, Network Processors (NPUs), Packet Processors (PPs) and Fabric Interface Chips (FICs).
The DIGI-G5 provides numerous benefits to both service providers and OEMs:

ul.li: Allows service providers to save on CAPEX by enabling cost-optimized, universal multi-rate, multi-protocol client and line-side facing cards for packet optical transport platforms.
Allows service providers to save on OPEX by enabling the lowest cost of ownership through simplified inventory management of a single multi-rate, multi-application universal line card.
Lowers the cost of 100G deployments by delivering high-capacity OTN and packet switching.
Enable the transition to support beyond 100G (B100G) Ethernet and flexible packet services as required by next-generation data center connectivity for cloud services.
Provides OEMs with a single-chip solution that can be leverage across multiple applications and across multiple platforms, reducing their cost of R&D development (both hardware and software).

The DIGI-G5 provides flexible service delivery:
Transparent mapping of 10GbE, 25GbE, 50GbE, 100GbE, 200GbE and 400GbE over OTN.
Supporting OTU4, OTUC1, OTUC2, OTUC3, OTUC4, OTUC5, OTUC6 and FlexO IrDI / IaDI interfaces.
Support for FlexE 1.1 including termination and FlexE-aware mapping to OTN up to 600G.
Supports multiple stages of OTN multiplexing to bridge between multiple generations of OTN network architectures.
Supports integrated OTN switching for on-chip ODUk grooming.
MAC termination of all Ethernet clients to enable packet switched line cards.
Mapping of IP, Ethernet or MPLS/MPLS-TP packets over OTN.
Supports flexible service delivery models with both wavelength and sub-wavelength level OTN encryption enabling encryption support over an OTN switched network infrastructure.
Supports PTP/1588v2 timing across an OTN network with integrated time stamping support and PTP over OTN overhead.
Directly supports a wide range of standards-based optical transceivers and modules without needing external PLLs or gearboxes, including SFP+ (limiting), CFP2 MSA, CFP4 MSA, QSFP28, QSFP+, QSFP-DD, QSFP56, SFP28, SFP56 µQSFP and OSFP.
